item.description:
The Confederacy in History, Myth, and Memory

A century and a half after the war, this topic continues to fascinate a global audience. Why? How has the memory developed from the eras of the War, the Lost Cause, Civil Rights, and today?

Waite Rawls, President and CEO of the Museum of the Confederacy in Richmond, spent 30 years as an investment banker in New York and Chicago before returning to his native Virginia 8 years ago. He is a graduate of the Virginia Military Institute and has a JD and MBA from the University of Virginia. He believes that history is relevant in the 21st century, especially its complications and nuances.


November 27, 2012
1154 Boylston Street
Boston, MA 02215

Join us at 5:30 p.m. for refreshments. Lecture begins at 6:00 p.m.

item.name: Free Tuesday night Lecture - The Confederacy in History, Myth, and Memory
